column5: Hi all. Looking for some input. Trying to make an education / informed decision. Going to LOTW in August. Can't decide what area of the lake to go to. Looking at Sab-bay area, or Kenora area. Like fishing for walleye, musky, pike. I've never been to the Kenora area, but I've fished several times in the Sab-bay area. Any input would be greatly appreciated

I have fished Sabaskong bay in the past. I also fished sioux narrows area once many years ago. Seems like the water gets deeper and clearer the further north you go. Never been to the Kenora area on LOW, so not sure how the water is there.
Guest 99 What are you looking at as far amenities and are you familiar with the lake at all?

pjm thanks, We would bring all of our own food and our own boat. Nice cabin and nice dock and good fishing. Just was trying to get some different opinons on the 2 different sides of the lake. Not familiar with the north end, but I do have gps with lake map on it. I would be comfortable navigating on the lake.

Spruce Island Camp is nice, great cabins and it's smack dab in the middle of the lake. So you could fish anywhere, go North one day, South another... not that you need to as the fishing in the area is great.

The Sioux Narrows area puts you in the heart of good musky fishing in Whitefish Bay area and great walleye fishing in the Yellowgirl area but also larger walleyes in the entire area close to Sioux Narrows.
P.m. Me for more info , thanks
